ygData.subject: RE: Carillion song (was  Bard only equipment, a rant)
ygData.msgSnippet: You could do that except the factions on guards and merchants are usually different factions and sometimes conflicting so making one happy does not necessarily
ygData.messageBody:
You could do that except the factions on guards and merchants are usually
different factions and sometimes conflicting so making one happy does not
necessarily make you safe from the other simultaneously. The main problem
is that our carillon song is not good enough to convert a KOS enemy to a non
KOS enemy. Mainly it seems to exist for the purpose of gaining faction for
better buying/selling prices and obtaining/completing more quests.

- Faras

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
> Sent: Friday, September 17, 1999 3:14 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Carillion song (was Bard only
> equipment, a rant)
>
>
> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
> So based on what you are saying, I could go into Feerot,
> target an ogre
> guard (bouncer), sing the carillion and make it to where I'm not KOS
> anymore, and then merrily waltz around the zone with no worry of ever
> getting attacked by any ogre guards.
>
> Galtin of E'ci
>
> > >IIRC, it only works on one target and wears off very quickly.
> >
> > It only works on one target but appears to last on all
> members of that
> > NPCs
> > "type" until you zone. make one shopkeeper happy and all of
> that "type"
> > which may vary. Make a guard happy and the shopkeepers
> don't like you
> > again...just a typical day in Highpass Hold/High Keep for me!
> >
> > Tszaaz E'Taurguin
> >
> >
> >
